line_1: Then tho' I drudge thro' dub an' mire
line_2: Gie me ae spark o' Nature's fire,

line_1: Then tho' I drudge thro' dub an' mire
line_2: That's a' the learning I desire;

line_1: Then tho' I drudge thro' dub an' mire
line_2: My Muse, tho' hamely in attire,

line_1: To trail the Swains among the Mire,
line_2: Then Will, who bears the wispy Fire

line_1: Afflicted Cymon waddles through the Mire,
line_2: And rails at Win'fred creeping o'er the Fire.

line_1: How rude are the Boys that throw Pebbles and Mire!
line_2: There's none but a Madman will fling about Fire,

line_1: A thoughtless Insect trampled in the Mire,
line_2: Or a proud Beauty in her Bloom expire.

line_1: Flung backward; rolling in the mire,
line_2: The horse, from scorn provok'd to ire,
